title: uv version in cache key
body:
With the recent move to enable caching by default, the cache lifetime might be more a question.

The cache key currently includes uv version. As uv is a quickly moving target (2 releases a week) and the action always using the latest version (unless a specific one is pinned), this effectively discards the cache every couple of days.

I know there were some situations in the past when CI cache pruning corrupted cache, but generally the cache should be compatible between uv releases.

Maybe it's time to reconsider this part of the cache key?
author: nijel

comments.body: That's a good idea! The mechanism was carried over from setup-rye and now that uv makes sure to detect old version caches we do not need this anymore.

title: Ambiguity in whether to use `actions/setup-python`
body:
The first answer to the FAQs on this project's README suggests not to use `actions/setup-python` and to instead make use of uv managed Python installations.

This is in contrast the the official uv documentation about integration with GitHub workflows, which suggests to make use of `actions/setup-python` for a performance benefit due to the python executables being cached alongside GitHub's runners.

Please could some clarification be made either as a response in this issue, an amendment to the FAQ on the README or a change to uv's documentation to clarify whether or not `actions/setup-python` has any benefits or is made redundant by this project.

Many thanks.
author: CarrotManMatt

comments.body: Yes the documentations don't match up. I will fix that. In the meantime: It is perfectly fine to use `actions/setup-python` and might even save ~1s. But for most usecases you don't **have** to use it. I will make that more clear in the documentation.

title: Feat: uv python list
body:
It would be nice to have an output that list and filter the python versions supported by uv.

For example to filter the different major versions:

```console
uv python list --all-versions --python-preference only-managed | awk -F ' ' '{print $1}' | awk -F '-' '{print $2}' | awk -F '.' '{print $1 "." $2}' | awk '!NF || !seen[$0]++'
```

Other filters could be defined for example
  - cpython vs pypy
  - minor vs major
  - use pyproject.toml `requires-python` to filter the list

That would be very useful to automatically design test matrix.
author: RomainBrault

comments.body:
I don't understand what your goal is, can you please give an example of how you imagine the workflow to look like?

As far as I understand it I think it exceeds what this actions responsibility is "Make uv available and usable on all GitHub Action Runners as efficiently as possible"

Yes,  as per the goal stated it makes more sense to have this in a separate action.

Here's the idea if someone or I have interest or time to work on it:

```yaml
list-python:
    name: Get relevant and available Python
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
        - name: Install a specific version of uv
          uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v3
        - name: Checkout Repository
          uses: actions/checkout@v4
        - name: List Python  # Here find the relevant Python based on uv and pyproject.toml for example
          id: list-python
          run: ...
    outputs:
        available-python-versions: ${{ uv.list-python.outputs.available-python }}

tests:
    name: Tests on ${{ matrix.python }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: list-python
    strategy:
        matrix:
            python: ${{ needs.list-python.outputs.available-python-versions }}
    steps:
          - name: Install a specific version of uv
            uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v3
          - name: Install Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
            run: uv python install ${{ matrix.python-version }}
```
